data.title: Move shared process to a browser window
data.body:
Moving the shared process to a browser window will enable it to use Chrome's network stack. This will affect mostly the extension viewlet.

Related to #18103

data.title: ATA Intellisense doesn't work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.1 (653f8733dd5a5c43d66d7168b4701f94d72b62e5, 2017-03-02T00:33:15.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.7|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.4.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I have the express in package.json, but when editing, get no intellisense for it.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8519685/23547819/a7c785f6-003f-11e7-8b6c-5197dfa219ce.png)
I noticed the tsserver is running, and the tsserver trace:
---
>[Trace - 6:35:57 PM] Event received: telemetry (0).
Data: {
    "telemetryEventName": "typingsInstalled",
    "payload": {
        "installedPackages": "@types/finalhandler@ts2.2,@types/ms@ts2.2,@types/mocha@ts2.2,@types/benchmark@ts2.2,@types/istanbul@ts2.2,@types/seedrandom@ts2.2,@types/debug@ts2.2,@types/escape-html@ts2.2,@types/on-finished@ts2.2,@types/supertest@ts2.2,@types/inherits@ts2.2,@types/statuses@ts2.2,@types/expect.js@ts2.2,@types/depd@ts2.2,@types/http-errors@ts2.2,@types/mime@ts2.2,@types/range-parser@ts2.2,@types/parseurl@ts2.2,@types/send@ts2.2,@types/csv-parse@ts2.2,@types/stream-to-array@ts2.2,@types/ncp@ts2.2",
        "installSuccess": false,
        "typingsInstallerVersion": "2.2.1"
    }
}
[Trace - 6:35:57 PM] Event received: endInstallTypes (0).
Data: {
    "eventId": 2,
    "packages": [
        "@types/finalhandler@ts2.2",
        "@types/ms@ts2.2",
        "@types/mocha@ts2.2",
        "@types/benchmark@ts2.2",
        "@types/istanbul@ts2.2",
        "@types/seedrandom@ts2.2",
        "@types/debug@ts2.2",
        "@types/escape-html@ts2.2",
        "@types/on-finished@ts2.2",
        "@types/supertest@ts2.2",
        "@types/inherits@ts2.2",
        "@types/statuses@ts2.2",
        "@types/expect.js@ts2.2",
        "@types/depd@ts2.2",
        "@types/http-errors@ts2.2",
        "@types/mime@ts2.2",
        "@types/range-parser@ts2.2",
        "@types/parseurl@ts2.2",
        "@types/send@ts2.2",
        "@types/csv-parse@ts2.2",
        "@types/stream-to-array@ts2.2",
        "@types/ncp@ts2.2"

    "success": false
}
---

and I also have some questions:
1. where the ATA have downloaded the types in so that I can check the ATA works well?
2. I got the this message from [official document](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8519685/23548182/34aa5ee8-0041-11e7-87f9-6f65a8e74ac3.png)
so now ATA supports bower without any configuration, right?
3. ATA should work without jsconfig.json, and intellisense can also work without jsconfig.json, right?

data.title: Move shared process to a window
data.body:
Moving the shared process to a browser window will enable it to use Chrome's network stack. This will affect mostly the extension viewlet.

Related to #18103

data.title: Error message when clicking on "Release Notes" button in update message.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:
```
Version 1.9.1
Commit f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519
Date 2017-02-08T23:44:55.542Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```
- OS Version:
```
Linux designbox 4.9.11-1-ARCH #1 SMP PREEMPT Sun Feb 19 13:45:52 UTC 2017 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

This issue is back : https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17455
Not exactly a showstopper.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start Visual Studio Code.
2. Wait for the info message "There is an available update" to appear.
3. Click the "Release Notes" button.
4. Error pops : ``Unable to open 'Release Notes: 1.10.1': Cannot read property 'replace' of null``

![vscode-update-message-cannot-read-property-bug-1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22870070/23547663/61658e0e-0004-11e7-8c73-4736c6967228.png)

![vscode-update-message-cannot-read-property-bug-2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22870070/23547675/6cca7390-0004-11e7-8a46-90496a7f2b6e.png)

data.title: UX: unnecessary "Reload window?" prompt after extension update
data.body:
I've got around 20 extensions installed and their updates are hence quite frequent. I often see this dialog:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/101152/23547302/f78a7306-0002-11e7-8a0a-26603a14a4fe.png)

I don't think it's useful as the operation is safe (especially with hot reload) and was explicitly invoked by me moments ago.

data.title: Fold/Unfold shortcuts like Ctrl+K Ctrl+1, Ctrl+K Ctrl+J do not work on Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

* Manually `Fold Level 1` (or 2, 3, 4) from "Show and Run Commands" bar works, but all shortcuts `Ctrl+K` `Ctrl+1` (or `2`, `3`, `4`) does not work
* The shortcut `Ctrl+K` `Ctrl+J` (`Unfold all`) also does not work. Works only when calling manually from "Show and Run Commands" bar

I looked if there might be another program (closed almost everything) on Windows which might capture `Ctrl+K` globally, but could not find any. Also in the Extensions panel `Ctrl+K` `Ctrl+M` works ("Show recommended keymaps")

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|elm-format|abadi199|0.1.0|

|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-pandoc|DougFinke|0.0.8|
|java-debug|DSnake|0.0.2|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.8|
|nuget4code|fforjan|0.0.2|
|Ionide-FAKE|Ionide|1.2.3|
|Ionide-fsharp|Ionide|2.23.5|
|Ionide-Paket|Ionide|1.6.1|
|tsd-recommender|jrieken|0.0.2|
|vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.8|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.52|
|gitignore|michelemelluso|1.0.1|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.1|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.7.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.5.4|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|
|elm|sbrink|0.8.3|
|velocity|sodatea|0.0.3|
|eval|Stormspirit|0.0.5|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.17.2|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.4.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a specific large file with a .txt extension that holds about 15MB of XML content.

Expected behavior: File should open as normally, understandably laggy given the size.

Actual behavior: File opens for a few seconds and then VSCode consistently crashes shortly after.

NOTE: The file holds confidential data but it is invalid XML that doesn't appear to have line breaks at a glance.

data.title: Support to set different themes against different file extensions
data.body:
Can we please support the ability to set different themes for different file extensions? Reason for that: sometimes a theme is suitable this file extension but not for the others. For example, in my opinion, HTML code looks best in Kimbie Dark theme, but C# code file is highlighted best in Monokai Dimmed theme, so that I want:
- set Monokai Dimmed as the common theme for the whole project
- especially for HTML file, use Kimbie Dark theme

If we can support that, I'm sure it would be one of the key feature make VS Code different with all other IDE such as Atom, Sublime etc.

data.title: Search gear for excluded files should be more helpful (lost function?)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is something we lost when transitioning to the new Settings experience. The gear icon in search has 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/23543204/7a624c66-fff1-11e6-997b-a974d4d81d8b.png)

previously guided the user to the 'search.excludes' setting. Now it just opens the settings editor.

Suggest to either show the setting name in the label or to filter the settings view with 'search.excludes' as shown below.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/23543233/9f118356-fff1-11e6-8a0e-a0e33e407a10.png)

data.title: Allow copy for "editor.dragAndDrop"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Win10

I enabled `editor.dragAndDrop` and it works as expected.

But I also expected Ctrl+DragAndDrop to copy the selection to the new location (without using the clipboard) instead of moving it.

If you implement this, please change the mouse cursor while dragging it, similar to Word.

data.title: proposal to fix issue 21600
data.body:
Hello, I got a proposal to resolve #21600. 

The `showPreviousSearchTerm` function tried to get the previous search term, but since `clear()` does not add a value to the `searchHistory` the `showPreviousSearchTerm` returned the one last search term.

This is my first pull request, so please let me know if anything is wrong.

Hope it helps!

data.title: editorScroll has regressed in VSCode 1.10
data.body:
In VSCodeVim, we are using the "editorScroll" command to move both the cursor and the page up and down by half-pages when the user types Ctrl-u and Ctrl-d, respectively.

In VSCode 1.9.1, this worked fine.

In VSCode 1.10.0, this has broken. The cursor no longer consistently moves up or down the page.

This has accumulated (relatively, for us anyways) a large number of thumbs up on our issues page: https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1348#issuecomment-283712969 

Help!

data.title: FR: customise git gutter styling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: 10.12.3

It would be great if we could customise the git gutter styling. I find the visual studio gutter styling to be too indistinct to be useful:

![screen shot 2017-03-03 at 11 12 44 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/61148/23536798/5a61f9b4-0002-11e7-9fdf-04b6312f07dd.png)

For comparison, here is how I have it configured in Atom:

![screen shot 2017-03-03 at 11 08 11 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/61148/23536762/18bc95dc-0002-11e7-9d3e-a9cf0d687fbf.png)

At the screenshot window sizes, it is not that much of an issue, but full screen it certainly is.

data.title: How to achieve typescript code completion in html
data.body:
I want to achieve typescript code completion in html, like  

```xml
developer.ts
export class Developer{
id:number
....
}
```
```xml
<div >
<select class="form-control" ngControl="technology">
{{  developer }}
</select>
<div>
```

when type 'developer'  in html, I wish html editor can  complete  properties。

In this scenario, Can i use tsserver.js to achieve  ts completion like in ts editor.

data.title: [i18n] Chinese Translation Issue
data.body:
i18n/chs/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/browser/extensionsActions.i18n.json
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11925432/23535823/c89b3fbe-fffb-11e6-91d7-1e9b0bafd9dc.jpg)

The translation of "enableAll" and "disableAll" are the same.
